PAD_FoundParents.synopsis: PAD when seeing Arabella's parents. One version if it is the mother, one if it is the father, and one if you never met them.

ZombieArabella_Dead.synopsis: Arabella has been found dead. This means player refused to find her parents earlier, and she then ran off.
ZombieArabella_Dead.how_to_trigger: goto -150; 31; 18, ctrl-k Arabella to kill her and test SWD.Alternatively, go to -150; 31; 18, speak with Arabella, say that you aren't going to help her. She will disappear out of sight - then go to-157; 21; -85, find her corpse and SwD

AD_Arabella.synopsis: Arabella calls out for her parents from within the cursed land, or speaks to herself to calm herself down.

TownIntroduction.synopsis: Player comes upon a familiar face in the cursed land: Arabella, the girl they rescued from the snake in act 1. She has developed powers and is rooting shadow-creatures. She promises you to teach you this entangling power if you save her parents, who are lost.
TownIntroduction.how_to_trigger:
ReCon (commands must be done in this order):
- SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_ShadowDruid_State_SnakeCourtStarted- 
loadlevel SCL_Main_A
- addTag ACT2_SHADOW_CURSE_IMMUNE:b47643e0-583c-4808-b108-f6d3b605b0a9  (so we don't die of shadowcurse)
- goto -150; 31; 18

Then talk to Arabella

ParentA_Dead.synopsis: Arabella's dead father, corpse found in the surgeon's general vicinity.
ParentA_Dead.how_to_trigger: - Load SCL_Main- Debug book - act 2 set up - Teifling path- give QUEST_SCL_Moonlantern_000  (so we don't die of shadowcurse) and equip- goto -150; 31; 18- Talk to Arabella / or not- teleport S_DEN_ParentA- oe debugbook > useful spells > speak with dead - debug- use spell on corpse.

PAD_FoundParents_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundParents_1.text: That corpse - a tiefling. But not one I recognise.

PAD_FoundParents_2.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundParents_2.text: I - I know that corpse. Arabella's father.

ZombieArabella_Dead_24.speaker: Narrator
ZombieArabella_Dead_24.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

ZombieArabella_Dead_8.speaker: Lae'zel
ZombieArabella_Dead_8.text: Her fate was writ the moment she fled.

ZombieArabella_Dead_19.speaker: Shadowheart
ZombieArabella_Dead_19.text: She survived the druids' wrath, just to wind up like this. What a waste.

ZombieArabella_Dead_2.speaker: Karlach
ZombieArabella_Dead_2.text: Tsk. I really hoped it wouldn't come to this. Poor thing.

ZombieArabella_Dead_14.speaker: Player
ZombieArabella_Dead_14.text: Why didn't your spell keep you safe?

ZombieArabella_Dead_6.speaker: Player
ZombieArabella_Dead_6.text: I'm sorry. I should have helped you.

ZombieArabella_Dead_4.speaker: Narrator
ZombieArabella_Dead_4.text: *The corpse remains silent. You did not ask it a question.*

ZombieArabella_Dead_29.speaker: Narrator
ZombieArabella_Dead_29.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

ZombieArabella_Dead_26.speaker: Astarion
ZombieArabella_Dead_26.context: NodeContext: Looking down at a dead child. Astarion saw her try to rob a sacred idol from some druids and respected her gumption. A touch of wistfulness, but not enough to betray his true emotions

ZombieArabella_Dead_13.speaker: Wyll
ZombieArabella_Dead_13.text: Poor thing. We could have - should have - done more...

ZombieArabella_Dead_20.speaker: Gale
ZombieArabella_Dead_20.text: I'm sorry it had to come to this, Arabella. You were brave and fierce beyond your years.

ZombieArabella_Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
ZombieArabella_Dead_30.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_Arabella_3.speaker: Arabella
AD_Arabella_3.text: Mum, pops - can you hear me?
AD_Arabella_3.context: NodeContext: Calling out, trying to find her parents.

AD_Arabella_2.speaker: Arabella
AD_Arabella_2.context: NodeContext: Calling out, trying to find her parents.

AD_Arabella_4.speaker: Arabella
AD_Arabella_4.text: Hello? Pops, are you out there?
AD_Arabella_4.context: NodeContext: Calling out, trying to find her parents.

AD_Arabella_0.speaker: Arabella
AD_Arabella_0.text: Please, please, please be all right...

AD_Arabella_5.speaker: Arabella
AD_Arabella_5.context: NodeContext: Calling out, trying to find her parents.

AD_Arabella_6.speaker: Arabella
AD_Arabella_6.context: NodeContext: Calling out, trying to find her parents.

TownIntroduction_75.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Before Arabella can finish, there is an eeries noise coming from behind her. Arabella turns to look as two Shadows emerge from the ground menacingly.NodeContext: About to continue from 'Hey, I know you! You're - ' with a proper introduction, but is interrupted by shadow creature spawning from ground.

TownIntroduction_152.context: CinematicNodeContext: The creatures groan menacingly and prepare to lunge

TownIntroduction_120.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arbaella starts moving her hands to cast a spell, in the manner of Jaheira casting entangling vines.

TownIntroduction_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella casts her spell. Before the creatures can attack, vines rise from the ground and wrap around them, entangling them to her right

TownIntroduction_6.speaker: Lae'zel
TownIntroduction_6.text: Impressive. Last I saw this child, she was cowed to Kagha's snake.

TownIntroduction_3.speaker: Shadowheart
TownIntroduction_3.text: Isn't that Arabella? The little girl Kagha nearly killed?

TownIntroduction_126.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella turns away from the trapped creature, exhausted.

TownIntroduction_128.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_128.text: Sorry. Knocks the wind right out of me.
TownIntroduction_128.context: NodeContext: Said with a deep sigh

TownIntroduction_12.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_12.text: I'd be more impressed if you'd actually killed it.

TownIntroduction_143.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_143.text: I don't know how. I'd kill 'em all if I could. I - I just want my mum and pops.

TownIntroduction_112.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_112.text: We followed Zevlor out here. Then he - he -

TownIntroduction_17.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_17.text: Arabella? You should be with your parents.

TownIntroduction_65.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_65.text: That's who I'm looking for. Mum and pops, I mean. When Zevlor - when he -
TownIntroduction_65.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

TownIntroduction_57.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_57.text: Well. There was an ambush. Mum yelled 'run!' So we ran.
TownIntroduction_57.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

TownIntroduction_59.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_59.text: I could hear 'em running behind me. 'Til I couldn't.

TownIntroduction_54.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_54.text: Still can't find 'em - but I bet you can. You'll help me, I just know it!

TownIntroduction_45.speaker: Narrator
TownIntroduction_45.text: *You notice the girl shivering in fear and anger. She is not yet ready to hear the truth of her parents' fate.*

TownIntroduction_123.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_123.text: I'll find your parents - you can count on me.

TownIntroduction_0.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_0.text: I'll think about it. My hands are full with these cultists.

TownIntroduction_139.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_139.text: Fine. Whatever. I don't need you - I'll find them myself!

TownIntroduction_4.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_4.text: You're going to get yourself killed. I'll find them, all right?

TownIntroduction_136.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_136.text: Thanks so much. I knew you'd help me again!

TownIntroduction_53.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_53.text: The vines won't last forever. I don't - I don't s'pose I can stay with you?
TownIntroduction_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

TownIntroduction_149.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_149.text: Just 'til you find mum and pops. I won't be any trouble, I swear it!

TownIntroduction_14.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_14.text: I was just poking at the rancid dog-meat of your parents' corpses.

TownIntroduction_2.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_2.text: You're trying to scare me... to see if I'm tough enough to make it out there.

TownIntroduction_127.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_127.text: Their bodies fester, pumped full enough of quack serums, swelling organs ready to burst.

TownIntroduction_146.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_146.context: NodeContext: Starts to splutter with tears.

TownIntroduction_95.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_95.text: You're worse than all the nasties in this blighted place.
TownIntroduction_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella runs away into the darkness in the cinematic after this line to be found dead later.

TownIntroduction_51.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_51.text: I'm telling the truth: you don't want to find them.

TownIntroduction_157.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_157.text: Then what... what is even left for me to do?

TownIntroduction_159.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_159.text: Live, grow up, and make your path anew by my side.

TownIntroduction_62.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_62.text: You're right. If I become strong, they will look on me with pride from beyond.

TownIntroduction_109.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_109.text: I don't want to forget about them... I can't.

TownIntroduction_87.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_87.text: It doesn't matter what you do - you'll end up dead like them, out here.

TownIntroduction_111.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_111.text: I'll prove it. Let me help in the camp, til you bring mom and pops back to me.

TownIntroduction_55.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_55.text: Suppress your delight in her parents' death. Offer her shelter.

TownIntroduction_32.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_32.text: Muster some kindness for once. Offer her shelter.

TownIntroduction_29.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_29.text: Of course. You can stay in my camp.

TownIntroduction_71.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_71.text: So you send mum and pops there. I'll be waiting, hero-person!

TownIntroduction_176.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_176.text: There's an inn called Last Light. Alfira's there - you'll be safe.

TownIntroduction_124.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_124.text: There's an inn called Last Light. You'll be safe there.

TownIntroduction_103.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_103.text: I mean, I'm sure you think that. But you ain't seen what I seen.

TownIntroduction_164.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_164.text: I don't trust no one 'sides myself, no more - save three. Mum, pops, and you.

TownIntroduction_108.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_108.text: Take me in. I won't make a peep - cross my heart, hope to die.

TownIntroduction_98.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_98.text: Forget it. No kids in my camp.

TownIntroduction_160.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_160.text: Whatever - who needs your lousy camp? I got powers. All I need is me.
TownIntroduction_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arbaella runs off in gameplay afterwards.NodeContext: Was going to protest, but changes her mind and tries to sound confident as she prepares to face almost certain death

TownIntroduction_175.speaker: Lae'zel
TownIntroduction_175.text: Plucked from Kagha's talons, only to run to the shadows. Fickle, the both of you.

TownIntroduction_102.speaker: Shadowheart
TownIntroduction_102.text: I'm not sure I like her chances out here, even if she does have powers.

TownIntroduction_18.speaker: Astarion
TownIntroduction_18.text: I do like her spirit. I don't like her chances, but her spirit? Excellent.

TownIntroduction_46.speaker: Wyll
TownIntroduction_46.text: Sending a child out there to die? Damned spiteful. Figured you better than that.

TownIntroduction_171.speaker: Wyll
TownIntroduction_171.text: Sending a child out there to die? Damned spiteful - even for you.

TownIntroduction_85.speaker: Gale
TownIntroduction_85.text: That was rather inhospitable. She could well die out there, we should go after her.

TownIntroduction_80.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_80.text: Forget the search. Your parents are dead.

TownIntroduction_1.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_1.text: You lie! They're out there. And if you won't find 'em, I will!
TownIntroduction_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is frightened and angry. Darkness starts to surround her.NodeContext: Found out her parents are dead. Distraught - her sorcerous powers begin to manifest, intensifying her emotional state.

TownIntroduction_8.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_8.text: Your parents are with you always, in memory. Join my camp, let me help you.

TownIntroduction_44.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_44.text: You're right. If I do something stupid and end up dead, there'll be nobody to remember them.
TownIntroduction_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her emotional intensity lessens, and the darkness around her fades as she calms downNodeContext: Calming down, your former intensity lost as you come to terms with your grief

TownIntroduction_125.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_125.text: They're gone, Arabella - but you have a new family now. Come to my camp.
TownIntroduction_125.context: InternalNodeContext: I'm terribly sorry - it does seem you'll have to come up with a line powerful enough to feasible calm down a child in a denial part of grief. - EkatA

TownIntroduction_90.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_90.text: New... family? But I don't want...
TownIntroduction_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella calms down a bit but is still sad. The darkness surrounding her fades.

TownIntroduction_66.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_66.text: All right. I'll go to the camp, like you said. Just...

TownIntroduction_115.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_115.context: CinematicNodeContext: After the dialogue ends, she runs off in gameplay.InternalNodeContext: There is an identical node for other persuasion - this is a matter of me being lazy and using same stub text for both persuasion successes, don't read too deep into that - EkatA

TownIntroduction_78.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_78.text: I have a family. And if you won't find them, I will!
TownIntroduction_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella runs away into the darkness in the cinematic after this line to be found dead later.

TownIntroduction_27.speaker: Lae'zel
TownIntroduction_27.text: Capricious child. She almost got herself killed once. Seems she's intent on finishing the job.

TownIntroduction_82.speaker: Shadowheart
TownIntroduction_82.text: She's going to get herself killed out here, powers or not.

TownIntroduction_113.speaker: Karlach
TownIntroduction_113.text: Fierce kid. Doubt she'll survive the shadows, but I hope she'll surprise us.

TownIntroduction_33.speaker: Astarion
TownIntroduction_33.text: Pity, I kind of liked her. Oh well.

TownIntroduction_122.speaker: Wyll
TownIntroduction_122.text: Damn it - new powers or not, the kid's going to get herself killed.

TownIntroduction_172.speaker: Gale
TownIntroduction_172.text: Stubborn little tyke! Even if she can swing a spell or two, she's going to get herself killed out here.

TownIntroduction_13.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_13.text: People die, and that's that. You can stay in my camp, if you quit your blubbering.

TownIntroduction_48.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_48.text: Yeah. All right. If that's what I gotta do.
TownIntroduction_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella pulls herself together, trying to look tough, and the darkness around her dissipates.InternalNodeContext: There is an identical node for other persuasion - this is a matter of me being lazy and using same stub text for both persuasion success, don't read too deep into that - EkatANodeContext: Take a big breath before line, trying to keep from crying.

TownIntroduction_81.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_81.text: Camp, huh? Guess I'll see you when I see you.
TownIntroduction_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: After the dialogue ends, Arabella runs off in gameplay.

TownIntroduction_83.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_83.text: To the hells with your camp, and to the hells with you.
TownIntroduction_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is still angry. She runs off in gameplay.

TownIntroduction_16.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_16.text: Pops can't be dead. He said he'd never leave me, no matter what.

TownIntroduction_101.speaker: Narrator
TownIntroduction_101.text: *The girl's mind is closed to you.*

TownIntroduction_105.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_105.text: Do what you want. I'm not stopping you.

TownIntroduction_60.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_60.text: Good. To the hells with you.
TownIntroduction_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is still angry, and no longer cares about the danger around here. She runs off in gameplay.

TownIntroduction_69.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_69.text: Their corpses, maybe. Your parents are dead.

TownIntroduction_35.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_35.text: I've rarely seen corpses as violated as theirs are - it was quite the sight.

TownIntroduction_21.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_21.text: And then you'll teach me those powers of yours?

TownIntroduction_169.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_169.text: Sure. The vine trick, at least. Maybe some others.

TownIntroduction_28.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_28.text: And how much gold will you give me in return?

TownIntroduction_91.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_91.text: I got powers. But pulling coins from the sky ain't one.

TownIntroduction_7.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_7.text: Tell you what - I'll teach you the vine trick. Maybe some others.

TownIntroduction_154.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_154.text: But not 'til you get my mum and pops back.

TownIntroduction_31.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_31.text: Forget it, kid. You can take care of yourself, from the looks of it.

TownIntroduction_151.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_151.text: I mean, damn right I can! I don't need you. I'll do it myself. Hmph!
TownIntroduction_151.context: NodeContext: ... finding confidence again, and defiant as she prepares to leave and enter the dangerous shadows once more

TownIntroduction_162.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_162.text: Your parents are dead, sorry to say.

TownIntroduction_84.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_84.text: Your parents are test-fodder stuffed full of needles, little orphan.

TownIntroduction_133.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_133.text: That's a powerful spell. Where did you learn to do that?

TownIntroduction_61.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_61.text: You've learnt magic like my own, child. Who taught you druidcraft?

TownIntroduction_119.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_119.text: No one - I learnt it all on my own! Well... I had a little help.

TownIntroduction_79.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_79.text: You need to take care with wild magic. You could end up hurting yourself.

TownIntroduction_70.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_70.text: I don't think so. I'm good. Well, kinda good.

TownIntroduction_147.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_147.text: That druid idol I took? It changed me. I can do all sorts of stuff now, not just the vines.

TownIntroduction_58.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_58.text: I think real hard and say some loud words and then it happens. Mostly.

TownIntroduction_39.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_39.text: Nature's magic only grows stronger with age, little one. Learn to control it now, while you still can.

TownIntroduction_153.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_153.text: If I get strong enough, I won't have to run next time... Hmm.

TownIntroduction_138.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_138.text: Okay. I promise to be really good with practising - but only if you look for my mum and pops. Deal?

TownIntroduction_30.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_30.text: What are you doing out here? It's not safe.

TownIntroduction_93.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_93.text: I was looking. For mum and pops. When Zevlor - when he -
TownIntroduction_93.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

TownIntroduction_77.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_77.text: How about you teach me those powers of yours?

TownIntroduction_49.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_49.text: Mm. Maybe. But you gotta help me first.

TownIntroduction_68.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_68.text: Me and mum and pops, we followed Zevlor out here. Then he - he -
TownIntroduction_68.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

TownIntroduction_163.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_163.text: That's a powerful spell. Where did you learn to do that?

TownIntroduction_41.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_41.text: You've learnt magic like my own, child. Who taught you druidcraft?

TownIntroduction_142.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_142.text: Nature's magic only grows stronger with age, little one. Learn to control it now, while you still can.

TownIntroduction_63.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_63.text: And no wonder. You could hurt yourself with magic that wild.

TownIntroduction_118.speaker: Player
TownIntroduction_118.text: Normally tales of stolen artefacts are tragedies - I'm glad you've bucked that trend.

TownIntroduction_129.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_129.text: Tragedies? Them's the sad ones, right? I hope not.
TownIntroduction_129.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

TownIntroduction_24.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_24.text: 'Specially since mum and pops - After Zevlor - When he -

TownIntroduction_38.speaker: Karlach
TownIntroduction_38.text: Hey! That's Arabella. Kid from the druid's grove. That snake woman nearly did her in. Looks like she's learned a thing or two.

TownIntroduction_174.speaker: Astarion
TownIntroduction_174.text: It's you - our little idol thief from the druids' grove!

TownIntroduction_110.speaker: Wyll
TownIntroduction_110.text: Is that... the kid Kagha went after? Seems she's learned a new trick.

TownIntroduction_156.speaker: Gale
TownIntroduction_156.text: Wait, that's Arabella, is it not? Looks like she's got some new Weave up her sleeve.

TownIntroduction_155.speaker: Narrator
TownIntroduction_155.text: *You remember this girl - Arabella, from the druids' grove, the thief Kagha tried to punish.*

TownIntroduction_88.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction_88.text: I don't see any - wait. Here they come!
TownIntroduction_88.context: NodeContext: About to say she doesn't see any shadow creatures.

ParentA_Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
ParentA_Dead_30.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

ParentA_Dead_15.speaker: Lae'zel
ParentA_Dead_15.text: Arabella's father, in the oh-so-decaying flesh.

ParentA_Dead_32.speaker: Shadowheart
ParentA_Dead_32.text: Arabella's father. I recognise him from the grove - just about.

ParentA_Dead_12.speaker: Karlach
ParentA_Dead_12.text: That's... Arabella's father. From the druids' grove. Poor man.

ParentA_Dead_9.speaker: Narrator
ParentA_Dead_9.text: *It is a tiefling man, one you recognise from the druids' grove - the girl Arabella's father.*
ParentA_Dead_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

ParentA_Dead_29.speaker: Locke
ParentA_Dead_29.text: Locke... husband to Komira... father to Arabella...

ParentA_Dead_1.speaker: Player
ParentA_Dead_1.text: Why were you in this place?

ParentA_Dead_3.speaker: Narrator
ParentA_Dead_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

ParentA_Dead_40.speaker: Narrator
ParentA_Dead_40.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

ParentA_Dead_36.speaker: Narrator
ParentA_Dead_36.text: *It is a tiefling man - the girl Arabella's father, presumably.*
ParentA_Dead_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

ParentA_Dead_11.speaker: Narrator
ParentA_Dead_11.text: *It is a tiefling man, his face unknown to you.*
ParentA_Dead_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

ParentA_Dead_39.speaker: Astarion
ParentA_Dead_39.text: Arabella's father. First the druids, now this - our little idol thief has no luck at all.

ParentA_Dead_28.speaker: Wyll
ParentA_Dead_28.text: Hells. Arabella's father's met a most unpleasant end.

ParentA_Dead_33.speaker: Gale
ParentA_Dead_33.text: Arabella's father. Poor man met a ghoulish end.

ParentA_Dead_13.speaker: Lae'zel
ParentA_Dead_13.text: Must be Arabella's father. What's left of him, anyway.

ParentA_Dead_44.speaker: Shadowheart
ParentA_Dead_44.text: A tiefling. That's Arabella's father, I wager - or was Arabella's father.
ParentA_Dead_44.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

ParentA_Dead_37.speaker: Karlach
ParentA_Dead_37.text: Must be Arabella's father. Poor man. Hope he rests in peace.

ParentA_Dead_19.speaker: Astarion
ParentA_Dead_19.text: Not a good end. Doubly so if your little girl's asking strangers to find you.
ParentA_Dead_19.context: NodeContext: looking at the corpse of a man whose daughter asked us to find him

ParentA_Dead_42.speaker: Wyll
ParentA_Dead_42.text: The tiefling's seen better days. Arabella's father, I wager.

ParentA_Dead_5.speaker: Gale
ParentA_Dead_5.text: That must be Arabella's father. Poor man met a ghoulish end.

ParentA_Dead_43.speaker: Narrator
ParentA_Dead_43.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*
